body_html: TF is mostly used on linux-based systems, it seems natural to have code written for python 2.7, since TF supports this version of python outside Windows. I do agree with you, however, that at least the print functions could be written with parenthesis, just to avoid those simple incompatibility issues. I'm not part of the team, but I believe TF members wouldn't oppose the change, if you send a pull request with them.

body: TF is mostly used on linux-based systems, it seems natural to have code written for python 2.7, since TF supports this version of python outside Windows. I do agree with you, however, that at least the `print` functions could be written with parenthesis, just to avoid those simple incompatibility issues. I'm not part of the team, but I believe TF members wouldn't oppose the change, if you send a pull request with them.
